intro: Crossoliparis wendlandii, commonly known as the Wendland's crossoliparis, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Central America. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a complex arrangement of petals and stamens that set it apart from other members of the Asteraceae family. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories where it can receive adequate light without being exposed to direct sunlight. Its leaves are elongated and slightly hairy, adapted to retain moisture in its humid habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Crossoliparis wendlandii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
